t: Exodus 15

Then*p sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the Lord,*s and spake, saying, I will sing unto the Lord,*s for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
The*p Lord*s is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
The*p Lord*s is a man of war: the Lord*s is his name.
Pharaoh's*p chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea: his chosen captains also are drowned in the Red sea.
The*p depths have covered them: they sank into the bottom as a stone.
Thy*p right hand, O Lord,*s is become glorious in power: thy right hand, O Lord,*s hath dashed in pieces the enemy.
And*p in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.
And*p with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered together, the floods stood upright as an heap, and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.
The*p enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my lust shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
Thou*p didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sank as lead in the mighty waters.
Who*p is like unto thee, O Lord,*s among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?
Thou*p stretchedst out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
Thou*p in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed: thou hast guided them in thy strength unto thy holy habitation.
The*p people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
Then*p the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.
Fear*p and dread shall fall upon them; by the greatness of thine arm they shall be as still as a stone; till thy people pass over, O Lord,*s till the people pass over, which thou hast purchased.

Thou*p shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, in the place, O Lord,*s which thou hast made for thee to dwell in, in the Sanctuary, O Lord, which thy hands have established.
The*p Lord*s shall reign for ever and ever.

For*p the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the Lord*s brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
And*p Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
And*p Miriam answered them, Sing ye to the Lord,*s for he hath triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
So*p Moses brought Israel from the Red sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.
And*p when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.
And*p the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?

And*p he cried unto the Lord;*s and the Lord*s shewed him a tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the waters were made sweet: there he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them,

And*p said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the Lord*s thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the Lord*s that healeth thee.
And*p they came to Elim, where were twelve wells of water, and threescore and ten palm trees: and they encamped there by the waters.
